player

Class d10

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.d10

  • public class d10
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton class containing static methods that emulate a box of dice. It uses a static instance of java.util.Random, and as such may not be thread-safe on pre-Java5 virtual machines.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      d10() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int d(int sides)
      Roll a single die of the specified size.
      static int d(int num, int sides)
      Roll a number of dice of the specified size and return the total.
      static int d(int num, int sides, int bonus)
      Roll a number of dice of the specified size and apply the given modifier.

    • Constructor Detail

      • d10

        public d10()

    • Method Detail

      • d

        public static final int d(int sides)
        Roll a single die of the specified size.
        Parameters:
        sides - the size of the die to roll, ie the number of sides
        Returns:
        a random value between 1 and the value of sides, inclusive.

      • d

        public static final int d(int num,
    int sides)
        Roll a number of dice of the specified size and return the total.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of dice to roll.
        sides - the size of the dice to roll, ie the number of sides
        Returns:
        the total of the values generated by rolling the specified number of dice of the specified size.

      • d

        public static final int d(int num,
    int sides,
    int bonus)
        Roll a number of dice of the specified size and apply the given modifier. If the result is less than 1, then 1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of dice to roll.
        sides - the size of the dice to roll, ie the number of sides
        bonus - the bonus/penalty to apply to the total of the roll.
        Returns:
        the total of the values generated by rolling the specified number of dice of the specified size, plus the bonus, but not less than 1.
